item.title: 英国经济连续两个月萎缩，斯塔默再遭打击
item.description: 由于企业和消费者难以从美国关税和一系列增税措施的打击中反弹，英国经济连续第二个月出现萎缩。【原文：The UK economy shrank for a second straight month as companies and consumers struggled to bounce back from the blow dealt by US tariffs and a raft of tax increases.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国经济五月份连续第二个月意外萎缩
马来西亚芯片企业因关税忧虑暂停投资计划
item.description: 马来西亚半导体行业协会会长 Wong Siew Hai 表示，马来西亚的芯片公司正在等待美国关税问题的明朗化，因此暂缓投资和扩张。【原文：Chip firms in Malaysia are holding back on investment and expansion as they await clarity on tariffs from the US, according to Malaysia Semiconductor Industry Association President Wong Siew Hai.】

item.title: 菲律宾矿商向印尼的镍发货量激增
item.description: 菲律宾一家矿业公司的负责人表示，预计今年从菲律宾运往印尼的镍矿石将激增，以满足受雅加达限制国内生产影响的中资炼油厂的需求。【原文：Nickel ore shipments to Indonesia from the Philippines are expected to surge this year to meet demand from Chinese-owned refineries affected by Jakarta’s curbs on domestic production, according to the head of a Philippine miner.】

item.title: 随着炒作热潮的升温，《巫师》游戏制造商跻身欧洲最昂贵股票之列
item.description: 对一款遥遥无期的视频游戏上市的乐观情绪，使一家开发该游戏的波兰工作室成为欧洲估值最高的公司之一，甚至超过了国防和电气化等热门行业。【原文：Optimism over a distant video-game launch has turned a Polish studio developing the title into one of Europe’s most richly valued companies, topping even hot sectors such as defense and electrification by one measure.】

item.title: 降雨不足，西澳大利亚小麦产量将减少
item.description: 据一个行业组织发布的本年度首次预估数据显示，由于部分地区降雨不足，本季西澳大利亚州的小麦产量预计将下降。【原文：Western Australia’s wheat production is expected to decline this season following poor rainfall across some regions, according to an industry group, which issued its first estimates for the year.】

item.title: 卢特尼克和贝森特来访，日本赤泽面临不良影响风险
item.description: 日本最高关税谈判代表赤泽亮世未来几天可能会再次面临压力，因为他面临着错过与两位受托负责贸易谈判的美国重要官员在访问大阪时举行会谈的风险。【原文：Japan’s top tariff negotiator Ryosei Akazawa may come under renewed pressure in the coming days as he faces the risk of missing out on talks with the two key US officials entrusted with trade negotiations when they visit Osaka.】

item.title: 中国人民银行顾问敦促采取 2090 亿美元刺激措施应对美国关税
item.description: 包括一位中国央行顾问在内的学者表示，中国应增加多达 1.5 万亿元人民币（合 2,090 亿美元）的新刺激措施，以刺激消费支出并保持货币灵活性，从而应对美国关税对经济增长的拖累。【原文：China should add as much as 1.5 trillion yuan ($209 billion) in fresh stimulus to boost consumer spending and maintain currency flexibility to counter US tariffs’ drag on growth, academics including an adviser to the country’s central bank said.】

item.title: 对加密货币交易持乐观态度，中国券商股大涨
item.description: 中国券商股创下近九个月来的最大涨幅，原因是市场对更多公司可能获得加密货币交易牌照的乐观情绪不断升温。【原文：Chinese brokerage stocks posted their biggest jump in nearly nine months on growing optimism that more firms may get crypto-trading licenses.】

item.title: 印度 HCL Technologies 和 Tech Mahindra 揭开 IT 行业前景的面纱
item.description: 印度软件领军企业 HCL Technologies Ltd. 和 Tech Mahindra Ltd. 将在下周公布财报，让人们一窥南亚科技和软件行业的未来。【原文：Indian software leaders HCL Technologies Ltd. and Tech Mahindra Ltd. will offer a peek into the South Asian tech and software sector’s future when reporting earnings next week.】

item.title: 韩国贸易代表在美国贸易谈判中寻求 "着陆区
item.description: 韩国最高贸易官员在结束华盛顿会议并于周四晚些时候返回首尔后表示，与美国的关税谈判已进入关键阶段。【原文：South Korea’s top trade official said negotiations with the US on tariffs have entered a critical phase, after wrapping up meetings in Washington and returning to Seoul late Thursday.】

item.title: 高盛策略师上调亚洲股市目标，上调香港股市评级
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists raised their forecast for Asian stocks, citing a more favorable macro environment and greater certainty around tariffs.】

item.title: 铁矿石因中国房地产投机而实现第三周上涨
item.description: 由于市场猜测中国政府可能会采取更多措施来帮助陷入困境的房地产行业，同时也会着手解决工业产能过剩问题，铁矿石连续第三周上涨，可能创下 1 月份以来的最佳表现。【原文：Iron ore headed for a third weekly gain, potentially the best run since January, on speculation Beijing may do more to aid the struggling property sector, while also moving to tackle industrial overcapacity.】

item.title: GoTo 股票大跌 22 亿美元后有望反弹
item.description: 分析师称，东南亚今年表现最差的科技股有望反弹，因为它正朝着持续盈利的方向大步迈进，其金融科技业务也提供了大量的上升潜力。【原文：Southeast Asia’s worst-performing tech stock this year is poised to rebound as it makes strides toward sustained profits and its fintech business provides plenty of upside potential, analysts say.】

item.title: 印度拓宽全球基金进入 6,390 亿美元信贷市场的渠道
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度已经扩大了一种受外国投资者欢迎的衍生产品的使用范围，使他们能够更广泛地进入该国价值 6,390 亿美元的信贷市场。【原文：India has expanded the usage of a derivative product popular with foreign investors, according to people familiar with the matter, giving them wider access to the nation’s $639 billion credit market.】

item.title: 黄金连涨两日，关税和利率成为焦点
item.description: 黄金在连续两日攀升后趋于稳定，交易商关注唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税威胁和美国货币政策前景。【原文：Gold steadied after a two-day climb as traders focused on tariff threats from President Donald Trump and the outlook for US monetary policy.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对加拿大征收 35% 的关税，并提出了更高的全面税率
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在 Truth Social 上发表文章称，将对从加拿大进入美国的商品征收 35% 的关税。该关税水平将从 8 月 1 日起生效。【原文：President Donald Trump will levy a 35% tariff on goods coming into the US from Canada, he said in a post on Truth Social. The tariff level would take effect from Aug. 1.】

item.title: 地盘争夺战升温，阿里巴巴面临千亿美元战线加深的风险
item.description: 中国食品配送市场的一场持久战已使阿里巴巴集团市值缩水 1000 亿美元，对利润和投资者信心的损害仍未结束。【原文：A protracted battle in China’s food-delivery market has chopped $100 billion in market value from Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., with no end in sight for damage to profits and investor confidence.】

item.title: 简街事件冲击印度顶级交易所上市前估值
item.description: 印度证券监管机构对 Jane Street Group LLC 实施的临时交易禁令加剧了人们的担忧，即印度熙熙攘攘的衍生品市场交易量可能会下降，从而损害顶级交易所的业务。【原文：A temporary trading ban imposed by India’s securities regulator on Jane Street Group LLC is fueling concerns that volumes in the nation’s bustling derivatives market may drop, hurting business at the top exchange.】

item.title: 卢拉告诉特朗普没有美国贸易巴西也能生存
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦坚称，没有与美国的贸易，巴西也能生存，并将寻求其他伙伴来取代美国，这是对美国领导人唐纳德-特朗普威胁对南美国家征收50%关税后的一个尖锐回应。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insisted Brazil can survive without trade with the US and will look to other partners to replace it, a sharp response to Donald Trump after the American leader threatened 50% tariffs on the South American nation.】

item.title: 特朗普的铜关税将包括用于电网和数据中心的产品
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对铜征收 50%的进口关税，其中包括用于电网、军事和数据中心的材料。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s plan to impose 50% import tariffs on copper are set to include the kinds of materials used for power grids, the military and data centers.】

item.title: 交易商关注欧佩克+供应和特朗普关税，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于投资者权衡欧佩克+供应和唐纳德-特朗普总统关税的影响，石油在周四下跌超过2%后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after falling more than 2% on Thursday as investors weighed the fallout from OPEC+ supply and President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 日本接班人危机推动电梯帝国股价上涨 6000
item.description: 在日本庞大的企业版图中，有一家鲜为人知的电梯维修公司，它收购了没有继承人的家族企业，建立了一个帝国。【原文：Tucked away in Japan’s vast corporate landscape is a little-known elevator maintenance company which has built an empire buying up heirless family-run companies.】

item.title: 铜关税威胁绩优股，秘鲁维持关键利率不变
item.description: 秘鲁维持利率不变，因为其经济受到唐纳德-特朗普计划征收 50%铜关税的威胁。【原文：Peru kept interest rates unchanged as its economy comes under threat from Donald Trump’s plan for a 50% copper tariff.】

item.title: 审计师称英国 F-35 战斗机项目成本增至 710 亿英镑
item.description: 根据英国支出监督机构的一份报告，英国大幅扩充战斗机机队的计划将在未来四十年内耗资 710 亿英镑（962 亿美元），是最初估计的三倍多。【原文：The UK’s plan to significantly expand its fleet of fighter jets is poised to cost £71 billion ($96.2 billion) over the next four decades, more than triple the original estimates, according to a report by Britain’s spending watchdog.】

item.title: Pimco 看好日本，关税刺激多元化发展，吸引资本青睐
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：Japan has emerged as a prime destination for global investors as the trade war triggers a reassessment of capital flows into the US, according to Pacific Investment Management Co.】

item.title: 美元对中国交易员失去吸引力为人民币创造跑道
item.description: 中国交易员正在从美元撤出，这有助于缓解令银行系统惶恐不安的资金短缺问题，并为人民币进一步走高奠定了基础。【原文：Chinese traders are pulling back from the dollar, helping ease a shortage that has rattled the banking system and setting the yuan up for further gains.】

item.title: 中国股市与香港股市差距缩小，政策押注增加
item.description: 自 2008 年以来，中国股市一直落后于香港股市，但随着估值和对政策支持的乐观情绪重新点燃投资者的兴趣，中国股市正显示出迎头赶上的迹象。【原文：After lagging Hong Kong stocks by the most since 2008, Chinese equities are showing signs of catching up as valuations and optimism over policy support rekindle investor interest.】

item.title: 华尔街反弹后亚洲股市将攀升：市场综述
item.description: 周五，在财报季到来之前，看涨的企业报告推动美国股市创下新高，亚洲股市随之上扬。【原文：Asian equities were primed to advance Friday after bullish corporate reports propelled US stocks to new highs ahead of earnings season.】
